name: Self-Organized Criticality (Edge of Chaos)
description: The tendency of the swarm to self-organize to a critical state where activity avalanches follow a Power Law distribution, maximizing information transmission and dynamic range.
findings: Implemented Integrate-and-Fire dynamics in the swarm.
Observed that activity avalanches follow a Power Law distribution (alpha ~ 2.31).
The system naturally maintains itself at the 'Edge of Chaos' without external tuning of the control parameter.
This confirms that the swarm is optimized for computation and responsiveness.
implications: Information can propagate over long distances (correlation length diverges).
The system is robust to failures (no single point of failure).
